Editorial:
Welcome to edition 205 of Azure Weekly - the last issue of 2018!

Plenty of announcements/updates this week. Here they are:

  • Azure Monitor for containers now generally available
  • General availability: Azure Kubernetes Service in East Asia
  • Static websites on Azure Storage now generally available
  • Microsoft previews neural network text-to-speech
  • Azure HDInsight integration with Data Lake Storage Gen2 preview - ACL and security update
  • Power BI Dataflows and Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Integration Preview
  • Automatic performance monitoring in Azure SQL Data Warehouse (preview)
  • Public preview: JavaScript and page contracts in Azure Active Directory B2C policies
  • Native Python support on Azure App Service on Linux: new public preview
  • Python images for App Service Linux are now in preview
  • Connect Cognitive Services subscription to enable unlimited skillset execution
  • Power BI solution templates moving to open source
  • Presentation mode in Power BI Windows App
  • Power BI Desktop December 2018 Feature Summary
  • Power BI Developer community November update
  • Connect to On-premises Data in Azure Data Factory with the Self-hosted Integration Runtime - Part 1
  • Azure Functions now supported as a step in Azure Data Factory pipelines
  • Azure Service Fabric 6.4 refresh for Windows clusters
  • Azure databases for MySQL and PostgreSQL resource GUID changes
  • Azure Database for MariaDB name changes
  • Automate Always On availability group deployments with SQL Virtual Machine resource provider
  • Python in Visual Studio Code – December 2018 Release
  • New REST based Service Fabric PowerShell Module
  • Visual Studio Code Updates for Java Developers: Rename, Logpoints, TestNG and More
  • New Azure DevOps Work Item Experience in Visual Studio 2019
  • Azure Marketplace new offers - Volume 26
  • Azure Marketplace new offers – Volume 27
  • Streamlined IoT device certification with Azure IoT certification service
  • Azure Backup for SQL Server on Azure VMs resource GUID change
  • Application Insights – Advisory 12/13
  • Azure Backup Server now supports SQL 2017 with new enhancements
  • Deck the Halls with an Improved Visual Studio App Center Portal UI

As you know, we love all things API Economy at endjin, and I've had a number of conversations with Mohammed Brueckner on the subject over the last few months. He's been writing a blog series on "Defining value in the age of Platforms and APIs" which are well worth your time. Here's Part 1, Part 2, Part 3 and Part 4.

Thank-you for being subscribers this year, for all the emails, submitted links, retweets and words of encouragement. Have a lovely festive break, a happy new year, and see you again on the 6th of January 2019!
